newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Wegener finalises regional publisher buy.
newsitem.headline: Wegener finalises regional publisher buy.

text.p: Dutch publisher Wegener NV said on Wednesday it had finalised the acquisition of regional newspaper publisher PZC Holding B.V.
Wegener said it paid for the purchase in cash, without giving further details.
Wegener said it expected the acquisition to have a positive impact on its earnings per share.
The company already held 33.3 percent of PZC's shares, and announced in December it expected to purchase the remaining shares.
PZC publishes the Provinciale Zeeuwsche Courant which has a daily circulation of 61,000 in Zeeland province and several other local and regional titles.
The company made a net profit of 1.4 million guilders in 1995 on revenues of 66.9 million.
